meanings.sent1: After some thought, she decided to reaccept the job offer.
meanings.sent2: I will reaccept your apology if you show genuine remorse.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to reaccept the toy mouse as a peace offering.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to reaccept the horizon as it dipped below the skyline.
meanings.sent5: He had to reaccept the challenge and prove himself once more.

meanings.definition: To take back or receive again.
meanings.sent1: Please reaccept this gift as a token of my appreciation.
meanings.sent2: The store policy allows customers to reaccept items within 30 days.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to reaccept the rabbit back into the hat, but it refused.
meanings.sent4: The ocean seemed to reaccept the lost shipwreck into its depths.
meanings.sent5: She had to reaccept the borrowed book from her friend before returning it to the library.
